Authors:
Taides Tavares Santos, Tiago de Souza Leite, Casley Borges
Queiroz, Elza Fernandes de Araujo, Olinto Liparini Pereira, Marisa
Vieira de Queiroz
Title:
High genetic variability in endophytic fungi from the genus
Diaporthe isolated from common bean (Phaseolus vulgaris L.) in
Brazil
Keywords:
Diaporthe; Endophytic fungus; IRAP; REMAP; Genetic
variability
Abstract:
The genus Diaporthe is distributed around the world and
has a wide range of hosts. Fungi of this genus were reported as abundant
in the endophytic fungi community of common bean (Phaseolus vulgaris
L.). The goals of the present study were to identify, to analyze the
phylogenetic relations and to evaluate the genetic variability of
Diaporthe endophytic isolates. Diaporthe sp., D. infecunda, D. melonis
and D. phaseolorum were identified using multi-locus phylogeny (rDNA ITS
region; EF1-Î±, Î²-tubulin, and calmodulin gene sequences). IRAP
(Inter-Retrotransposon Amplified Polymorphism) and REMAP
(Retrotransposon-Microsatellite Amplified Polymorphism) molecular
markers reveal the existence of high genetic variability, especially
among D. infecunda isolates. It were concluded that the multi-locus
phylogenetic approach was more effective than individual analyses of ITS
sequences, in identify the fungus to species level, and that IRAP and
REMAP markers can be used for studying the genetic variability of the
Diaporthe fungal genus.
